eu.bavenir.vicinity.gatewayapi.xmpp

Class XmppConnectionDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.vicinity.gatewayapi.xmpp.XmppConnectionDescriptor

  • public class XmppConnectionDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of a connection to XMPP network. In essence, it is a client connected into XMPP network, able to send / receive messages and process the requests that arrive in them. Basically, the flow is like this: 1. construct an instance 2. connect() 3. use - since the clients connecting to XMPP network are going to use HTTP authentication, they will send their credentials in every request. It is therefore necessary to verify, whether the password is correct. The verifyPassword() is used for this and is probably called by RESTLET every time a request is made. 4. disconnect()
    Author:
    sulfo

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmppConnectionDescriptor

        public XmppConnectionDescriptor(java.lang.String xmppUsername,
                                java.lang.String xmppPassword,
                                org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                                java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        Constructor. It is necessary to provide all parameters. If null is provided in place of any of them, the descriptor will not be able to connect (in the best case scenario, the other being a storm of null pointer exceptions).

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Retrieves the XMPP user name used for this connection.
        Returns:
        XMPP user name, without domain (not a full JID).

      • verifyPassword

        public boolean verifyPassword(java.lang.String passwordToVerify)
        Verifies, whether the client using this descriptor is using correct password in its HTTP requests.
        Parameters:
        passwordToVerify - The password provided by client.
        Returns:
        True if the password matches the one used by this connection.

      • getConnection

        public org.jivesoftware.smack.AbstractXMPPConnection getConnection()
        Retrieves the connection to XMPP server in use by this descriptor.
        Returns:
        AbstractXMPPConnection.

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Connects to the XMPP server and logs the user in. It also registers a listener for incoming messages for this connection (see ChatManager). In case of failure it is possible to re-try.
        Returns:
        True on success, false otherwise.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection to the XMPP server. The connection can be re-opened.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if the descriptor has opened connection to the XMPP server.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • getRoster

        public org.jivesoftware.smack.roster.Roster getRoster()
        Retrieves the roster of the current XMPP user.
        Returns:
        An instance of Roster for this connection.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String destinationUsername,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Sends a string to the destination XMPP user name. The recommended approach is to get the roster first (by the getRoster() method and then send the message, if the contact is online.
        Parameters:
        destinationUsername - Destination contact, for which the message is intended.
        message - A string to send.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(org.jxmpp.jid.EntityBareJid destinationJid,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Sends a string to the destination XMPP JID. The recommended approach is to get the roster first (by the getRoster() method and then send the message, if the contact is online.
        Parameters:
        destinationJid - Destination contact, for which the message is intended.
        message - A string to send.

      • retrieveMessage

        public org.jivesoftware.smack.packet.Message retrieveMessage()

      • buildNewConnection

        private org.jivesoftware.smack.AbstractXMPPConnection buildNewConnection(java.lang.String xmppUsername,
                                                                         java.lang.String xmppPassword)
        Builds the connection object based on Gateway XML configuration file and the provided credentials.
        Parameters:
        xmppUsername - XMPP user name without the served domain (i.e. just 'user' instead of 'user@xmpp.server').
        xmppPassword - Password of the user.
        Returns:
        The established connection if the attempt was successful, null otherwise.

      • processMessage

        private void processMessage(org.jxmpp.jid.EntityBareJid from,
                            org.jivesoftware.smack.packet.Message message,
                            org.jivesoftware.smack.chat2.Chat chat)
        This is a callback method called when a message arrives. There are two main scenarios that need to be handled: a. A message arrives ('unexpected') from another node with request for data or action - this need to be routed to a specific end point on agent side and then the result needs to be sent back to originating node. b. After sending a message with request to another node, the originating node expects an answer, which arrives as a message. This is stored in a queue and is propagated back to RESTLET services, that are expecting the results.
        Parameters:
        from - A JID of the sender.
        message - Received message.
        chat - A chat thread in which the message was received.

      • processRosterEntriesAdded

        A callback method called when entries are added into the roster.
        Parameters:
        addresses - A collection of JID addresses that were added.
